data.title: Compare London & Manchester Weather and Climate
data.meta_description: Comparison of the weather and climate of London, United Kingdom with Manchester, United Kingdom including average yearly temperature, rainfalls, snowfalls and more.
data.text:
London is 262.4 kilometers (163.0 miles) away and has the same time zone with Manchester, United Kingdom. Both London and Manchester are in the same climate zone with Marine west coast, warm summer (Köppen climate classification: Cfb).

London generally has warmer weather than Manchester. The average mean temperature in London is 12.17°C (53.91°F) while Manchester’s temperature is 10.33°C (50.59°F) and the difference is 1.84°C (35.31°F). London is warmest on average in July, when the day time temperature may reach 19.93°C (67.87°F), while Manchester is warmest in July when the average high temperature is 17.15°C (62.87°F). London is coldest in January when the average low temperature is 2.34°C (36.21°F), while January is the coldest month in Manchester, when night time temperature often falls below 1.56°C (34.81°F).

Finally, London has about 1.48 times less rainfall than Manchester, (London’s 50.85mm vs Manchester’s average of 75.06mm).
